_exec_summary.SummaryText:
emergency response organizations shall be provided with a current issue of the emergency response plan and are invited to participate in annual emergency response exercises. Safety Data Sheets (SDS) for all hazardous materials stored on site are available to both site personnel and Edison Township emergency responders through our Hazard Communication Program. 

b) The stationary source and regulated substances handled

The facility is covered by EPA-RMP regulations due to the presence of Titanium Tetrachloride at the facility.

c) The general accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps

Site release prevention and chemical specific prevention includes process safety equipment, mitigation systems, and leak detection equipment, including a preventative maintenance program covering such equipment, an operator training program, and a Management of Change procedure.

Process safety equipment at the Edison Site includes relief devices such as relief valves and rupture disks, vents, check valves, quench systems, automatic shutoffs, interlocks, keyed bypasses, grounding and purge systems.

Mitigation systems in the accidental release prevention program include, enclosures, scrubbers, dikes, sumps, sprinkler systems, deluge systems, water curtains, a hazmat foam system, fire fighting foam systems, mineral oil dump systems, neutralization and fire water containment system.

Leak detection systems are installed in process areas to detect toxic or flammable leaks and oxygen deficient environments.

The preventative maintenance program conducts inspections and tests to assure the operation of preventive devices.  Management of Change assures that all changes are reviewed for their hazards before implementation and considers the need for process safety equipment, mitigation equipment, and leak detection systems.  All incidents are investigated to determine the root cause and corrective actions are implemented to prevent future incidents.

d) The f

ive-year accident history

No releases from the covered process met the requirements of Section 68.42 of 40 CFR 68 Subpart A.

e) The emergency response program

The site emergency response program meets the requirements of the EPA Integrated Contingency Plan Guidance.  The plan defines the response organization, coordination with the local emergency response committee, equipment, response procedures, training, notification procedures, and drills.  The plan is updated according to the recommendations from the system deficiencies uncovered by periodic drills and incident reports.

f) Planned changes to improve safety

A titanium tetrachloride unloading enclosure was installed and started up in 2014.  Unloading of tank trucks or isocontainers containing titanium tetrachloride is conducted utilizing the enclosure.  Additional mitigation includes the enclosure envelope (walls), dikes, a fume scrubber, sumps (secondary containment), gas detection, emergency shutdown/isolation, and mineral oil suppression.
